OTT2RN0jofQ9L78Byp-e-Q.text: the menu that is linked from Urbanspoon is for two other El Paso Mexican restaurants. the restaurant in Bridgeville claimed that they have NO website and they are NOT related to the other two El Paso Mexican rest. at mexicanrestaurantfinder.... me-beaver-falls-east-liverpool.html if you look at the menu from the link above and the one at Bridgeville restaurant they are the same! different format but the Dinner Combos are exactly the same! well we printed the coupon from the website link, showed our waiter, he said they take that at the cashier when you check out. we go to check out and they say that is NOT their coupon and we don't have a website only a $5 coupon of some sort... and that is not it. they were very rude about it as well... food was bland. Just coming from Los Cabos in Bloomfield restaurant last month... this place was a let down. service was fast but the food was just OK at best. the salsa for my taste was fine which was mild but the rest in my group preferred hot. so they added hot sauce to it. read on other review here on YELP that they have a hotter salsa if requested but they did not offer. also the server was fast but RUDE. he slammed down the salsa bottle and chips when first delivered. no apologies for almost splashing me with the salsa when that happened. It looks like the same menu as the Ray Azteca Restaurant menu in Sommerset, PA as well. I wonder if they order their menus from some generic Mexican restaurant website... Bottom line, poor server attitude, no customer service when their server did not tell us that it is not their coupon when we ordered and showed him... and bland food. Had combo 29 and it was bland and not as good as Ray Azteca Mexican and not in the same league as the Bloomfield Mexican restaurant.

G55DH4VwpBXo4GCKM0c2PQ.text: Decidely average. I've been to El Paso a few times due to the location. I have never been very disappointed but I've also never been impressed. Last Friday,  I went to El Paso with 3 adults and one baby at 8:30 for a quick dinner. The restaurant was about half full and we got a table right away. We ordered guacamole for an appetizer and I got the Chicken and Shrimp entree. The guac seemed fresh but was lacking in spice. Our entrees came out quickly and were satisfactory though my vegetables were obviously a mix of frozen carrots, broccoli and cauliflower. Can you say green giant? Also, the service is usually adequate though the wait staff often has some difficulty understanding any special orders/requests. For what it is, a small mexiacan place in a strip mall, it lives up to standards. However, if you're looking for good authentic mexican, it's worth the drive to El Campesino in Robinson.

aTG_DaRO6G89xN90xlW8OQ.text: My husband and I were there for dinner tonight at 5.00.  We were one of 3 occupied tables.  Our server was visibly annoyed to have to wait on customers from the very beginning with our drink orders.  When I asked for my sauce to be served on the side with my entree, he questioned my judgement.  The food was indeed delivered promptly.  But the quality was simply low average.  No cheese on the chicken enchilada and scant sprinkles on the beans.  Chicken was dry.  After delivering our meals he rejoined the other 3 waiters congregating in the back booth on the right.  The only thing he roused himself for, and seemed content to do, was deliver the bill.  There are so many superior Mexican restaurants in the South Hills that this one is definitely not worth the trip or the money.

aT-tfpTcz-hCRmaIZ-HAUQ.text: My husband and I come here often.. Mostly because my husband LOVES it.. I'm not big on Mexican food, but they do have options that are not spicy and I like. They are really fast and they have good customer service. You know its good when there is a line out the door on a Thursday night!

BjmNdjlQzCIw0lLFpRRZnw.text: Fooled yet again. This restaurant has great reviews but didn't fit the bill. Bland  guacamole. We saved it with the picante sauce served with the chips. Beef taco very dry. In their favor meal prices were very reasonable. But not enough for us to return.

x-_GFdImJqhaEVUnVJ2nVw.text: This place fills the void for good Mexican in the south hills. Great food good service

mkw2wDqvc0BqByi2Qv-osA.text: The food here is amazing and very authentic. It can be a little hard to understand them sometimes, but it's worth it. Also, the place doesn't get too crowded because it is in a strip mall and people don't understand how good it is. I have only good things to say about this place!

8fDdGBYBKbM_8t7lvhguow.text: I'll note the other one star review of this place relates to the coupon policy. So before I dive in, I'll say that if they honored their own coupons, this would be a 3* place. $8.50 for a combo plate that includes three items, food is decent and comes out very fast, service is average.  They have been in the Entertainment book for a while, in fact you can print out coupons for them from the website, which I did today. They have single handedly added a new restriction to the coupons of $25 minimum purchase. Just because they want to. Now, that's bad enough (and 3-2 star drop) but then the waiter simply rang me up at the pre-coupon price and said 'Come back next time and spend more!'   If they had any sense of customer service, they could have informed of the policy and I could have ordered dessert, which would have easily taken me over the coupon discount amount. But obviously they just didn't want to honor the coupon.  Well, I hope it was worth it. Since the waiter himself decided to simply ignore the coupon and ring me up, a couple bucks came out of his tip. I usually overtip with discount coupons and would have easily ended up spending the amount of the discount. Instead, they lost a customer for life (and I do live nearby) and I can only hope that fellow Yelpers will think twice before going here. I hope the couple bucks they scammed out of me was worth it.

G1IjFG_7Tl1tc5Ekes0rWg.text: An inexpensive authentic Mexican restaurant. Great food, fast service and awesome atmosphere. Flavors are great in the food, and the menu is huge, something for everyone, even the kiddos. I know I'll visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States

JqfKOsiAy8vXqM2bcEXJMw.text: I was very pleased with the menu and the authentic Mexican food at El Paso.  The food was cooked perfectly and the serving size was right on.  Did I mention that the margarita was a nice addition to the dinner.  I will definitely go back, maybe even once a week for lunch.  I would only recommend that they turn the TV's off during the dinner hours.  It was rather distracting.

dSk88FY-3fZVG2vq2zo2-w.text: Okay, kids.  This place is what it is.  Americanized, greasy fake mexican combos.    Frankly, I love this place.  It's super cheap, cheesy and tasty.  It's also super quick and easy.  Adjust your expectations, order a texas margarita (still super cheap) and eat some freshly fried chips.  You'll love it.

idbb4XLtujR0ONFo1qPEFA.text: This a lunch place. We were in for dinner and I felt cheated. Portion sizes are way small and they try to throw in a lot of onion and peppers in to hide that they are skimping on the meat. I ordered carnitas and I got one scoop of burned meat mixed with half raw onions. The remaining 3/4 of my plate was refried beans and rice. Gave it three stars because it was tasty, they  had queso fresco and was tremendously better than the slop they call Mexican food in WI!

i9hdbJtcigwh3EK2EEzKUA.text: Tasty stuff. Like the pollo fundido the best. The place is nice and clean and has beer too. A nice lunch option for under an hour and under 10 bucks.

lZ_YPFQ0lwluKxdKsfqJNQ.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the burgh! Having been born and raised in Southern California, I LIKE MEXICAN FOOD! Over the years we've tried different places around town, very few impress!  After our first visit to El Paso, we were hooked.  The decor and atmosphere are par for the average Mexican restaurant but the food is outstanding. One of my gauges when judging a Mexican restaurant is the chips and salsa.  At El Paso the chips are always hot and fresh and the salsa has a bold but smooth flavor.   When it comes to the menu, there's a lot to choose from but my absolute favorite is the Pollo Con Crema.  The chicken is tender, the sauce is creamy and full of flavor. (and who doesn't love hot flour tortillas!)  The tacos are fresh and the burritos are big.   The service is generally pretty good.  The food always arrives quickly (and hot!), it's those pop refills and special requests that sometimes take a little bit longer.  Check it out - you'll be glad you did!

IYj7s67lPQfo0iOT3j4v7Q.text: El Paso is an inexpensive authentic mexican restaurant.  Above each table/booth there is a mural, that I found out, portrays Dia dl los Muertos, the holiday in which families remember there deceased relatives...OK.  I noticed one large TV screen with the sound on mute, was told they play Mexican soccer games.  They do have margaritas, beer and I think Sangria.  The place was very crowded.    Service was good.  Immediately received warm chips and salsa.  Salsa was good but like mine a little spicier.  Of course after the meal, found out they do have a more spicy salsa, if you ask.    Had a taco, enchilada and beans.  The taco was bland, came with meat that was very bland and a little overcooked, white cheese (white american?) and lettuce.  The enchilada was better with a zesty red sauce.

TRuYsD7notOmiKgvSZQwEw.text: Good food & service, for what it is. The staff is regularly friendly and it works for family dinners as well

rdrwF3qKNC47yuhHVzHBOw.text: Was hesitant to try this place because it's in the strip mall. But I was pleasantly suprised! Very clean, great authentic food and atmosphere. The waiter was the best I ever had at any restaurant, ever. He never let my drink glass go empty. Highly recommend!

LP5iL9GRXToK-YHbR-BLLg.text: Food is way more than fairly priced for the flavor and the portions that you receive. The kitchen was willing to customize an order for me and I definitely will return

O7cMo_qzuwIveQtXY7tOQg.text: El Paso serves us as my substitute for the now-closed Cinco.  It's pretty good.  It's your standard Mexican peasant food restaurant (burritos, tacos, fajitas, enchiladas...) You get your chips and salsa.  While Cinco had a taste profile that swung more towards the Arizona restaurants I was used to, El Paso satisfies my craving for Mexican in the South Hills much better than most.

iO8m8vKmYPit_qT3VcouMQ.text: My favorite mexican restaurant in Pittsburgh! Large delicious portions. I always leave stuffed. Coming from a Verrrrrry large mexican family I def recommend. The only food in the area that reminds me of home.

xqAeyWM5Cy16VCn39Rp9wA.text: Solid Mexican food (for a strip mall in Bridgeville! If you are looking for fancy or upscale, keep looking. This has more of a family friendly atmosphere. It has a wide vegetarian selection. Service was faster then the speed of light and El Paso has very friendly and helpful staff. I will definitely come here again.

93x2ehQsXeOtTOgOQfmcZQ.text: I love traditional Mexican food, so when I came across El Paso, I was excited for another choice for when I was thinking beans and rice.  I wasn't overly impressed by El Paso- the interior was clean and had the usual sombrero's on the wall. The staff was just OK- they took our order and quickly brought our food, which was my minimum for good service. I was more impressed with the actual food. The menu has lots of good Mexican staples, and some things I've never seen before. For my meal, I tried the chicken with sour cream sauce. I can't remember the actual name of the entree, but if you go, get it. It's small bites of roasted chicken in a sour cream sauce flavored with Mexican spices, and accompanied by rice and beans and hot tortilla shells. I've never had anything like it, especially since sour cream sauce scared me, but it was really good. My wife had the chile rellenos, which were prepared in the more traditional style with the egg sauce on top.  I had an opportunity to try several of my friends' dishes, and they were all tasty, but a little different then my usual Mexican hangout, El Campesino. If you're looking for something a little different in traditional Mexican food and you're not big on ambiance, give El Paso a try.

Q7pxFgy4bbw0mFovUFeCFw.text: Fresh warm tortilla chips, great salsa, the burrito durango is out of this world! I'll be back tomorrow just to shove my face in that phenominal plate of awesomeness!

pnZvPiWYkjwTjJMgmQJZtQ.text: Look. It is hard for me to comprehend a bad review of this place. From the seating to the chips and salsa to the margaritas to the main course through to the flan. Positively brilliant. Could not have been better. Bitching about coupons and oooo I used to live in LA...give me a break...this is the real deal done correct-a-mundo!

dJ6n2EH6WotS67euZrXXiw.text: First time here. Bad customer service, and food is not great. Ordered the Carne asada and steak was burnt. Disappointed and won't come back. No black beans on menu. Chicken fajitas was bland, flavorless.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States

nT3I6IHQFpjTtoUga59K8Q.text: We go here often enough to know this place is good. It's not overly expensive and they usually have a coupon in mailers. I've yet to order anything from here that wasn't tasty.

vjCmoMm22pYmLxQfkLou1A.text: I base the legitimacy of a Mexican restaurant on whether or not they offer chorizo. So this place is -- as the young people say -- legit.   Take that how you will. My very unscientific and uncultured account of this restaurant was satisfactory. It seemed to be authentic and really embraced this style of Latin cooking, serving sizzling fajitas in a cast iron pan to the table.   It wasn't the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to in Pa. That's El Toro in Erie, Pa (RIP). But it's a better option than Mad Mex or Taco Bell.   I would recommend this place if you're in the area and jonesing for some spicy treats.

BPiCeX_hg1aOn6nSVIUX1Q.text: The food was delicious and the portions were gigantic. I really liked how everyone gets their own salsa bowl so the kids weren't fighting over the same bowl. The food came out really quick, but was hot and tasted fresh. Would've had 5 stars but the fact of no soap dispenser in the restroom made me wonder how sanitary the staff handling my food really is.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Fajitas Vallarta

uBAJTe6UH_6IuLy07H1epw.text: My boyfriend and I go out for Mexican food more than any other cuisine and we both agreed this is our new spot. The prices are very good and the portions are huge. I always have a second meal to take home. I just tried the margaritas this time and they were my favorite to date. The perfect amount of sweet, tart, and booze. Very smooth and the perfect complement to the food. We have had burritos, enchiladas, fajitas, and chorizo queso dip. All were fantastic. And I can't wait to see the murals on the walls finished. It's a great spot.

GsfENb6DjMOXGM2LTYVj1Q.text: I used to like this place until today.  1. Hair in the salsa..  gross but I moved on. 2. My order was wrong. ok. not a big deal but 2. Did not get any drink refills. Not nice. 4. I told my waiter that I didn't like my food because the order was wrong and he came back showed me his ticket  - he wrote it down wrong so I dont care about seeing the ticket. He should have just apologized and moved on. The customer is always right I didn't say that but he should know....AND then he yelled a complaint about me when he went to the kitchen. (I could hear him)  Not nice. I left hungry and angry.  Wont be back.

ZGBdAsuPzYSgvamU7il13Q.text: The staff is so quick it's amazing!!!! They are all so friendly . Although they do have heavy accents, I have never had any trouble understanding them. And they normally know exactly what your talking about without you needing to get into too much detail, which is pretty impressive.  I am a regular there, and their food has yet to disappoint me. There is nothing on their menu that you won't love, that's guaranteed.

38vcpb4n-9DTPHlxeYtdfg.text: Always delicious , hot and fast. Never over crowded & always great service. One of our favorite local Mexican restaurants. Love the convenience of location too!

6D8dr2nblCBNd01KI--ptw.text: My wife and I have been going here from the time they first opened.  I don't know why but the last two visits the food and service was not good.  There has been a big decline in the quality of the food served.  The waiters that were there a year ago are all gone and when we were there for lunch the last time there was one person taking orders, delivering food, and working the cash register.  No Mas....

1zzIgmOiuEYSPoeLoOmGcg.text: Went  here  for the lunch they other day!  They immediately brought out chips and salsa.  Ordered lunch #1, my friend she ordered the chicken quesadilla combo ! It was fantastic!!! I had a cooked green pepper with sauce and cheese , so soft and tasty!! Server was very "Attentive", and "friendly!"  Give the place a "thumbs up!!!  Reasonable too!

Dc6PvuuVq538PjxUU65fBw.text: First  off, it's not what one would call "authentic" Mexican food but it's really good! I've come here almost once a week and I love it! great prices, fast service, great margaritas, you can't go wrong! My favorite mexican food place in the area hands down!

qA_wam9lCyyYoOvyE2Kq1g.text: Strawberry margarita was great. 2 tables of entitle moo parents and their bad kids kept throwing food and bowls on the ground and swinging a monkey stuffed toy at us  I guess this attracts families , we wont be back.  Slow service and unenthusiastic server

BjH9ON2QImWK9UVysPZp2A.text: We love this place!  It is fast, authentic, and inexpensive . As soon as you sit down, someone puts a bottomless bowl of tortilla chips and salsa on your table.  The wait staff appears immediately taking your drink order.  Margaritas are great!  Low on ice and lots of alcohol.  The drinks come out in under 3 minutes.   Wide selection of the typical Mexican fare.  Have tried many, and all are good.  And it is also comes quickly.  The staff come by frequently to check on you, take away plates, bring more drinks, etc... El Paso is a sure thing

ozImHkleOY37DPS2YO_5kQ.text: This review is actually for the new one on the Bethel Park/USC line. Stopped in for lunch today. I suppose it's fine if your thing is the standard combo plate menu that 98% of Pittsburgh Mexican restaurants share. I don't get why someone would open up yet another one of those types of places - what's the vision if you're not going to do something different, or even just better? Menu had no seafood other than shrimp done the usual ways and bottom-feeding tilapia. I had the grilled shrimp in chipotle. It was merely OK. No real bite or depth to the chipotle sauce. Shrimp were "grilled" I suppose on a griddle, as there were no grill marks. No real reason to go back, but I doubt I'm their demographic as I'd be more up for a Bayless-type of menu.

YQBaIMORSEdih6D1_OfM4A.text: Let me start off by saying I'm from CA and wasn't expecting much from PA in the way of Mexican food!  Clean friendly place hidden in a corner of a strip mall... Let's start with the salsa, wasn't even close to the best I've had, wasn't terrible either. More like tomato sauce though. The meals were again not awful but far from what I'm accustomed to in CA. I was pleasantly surprised! Price was average I'd guess, and I would come again. If they could at-least get the salsa a bit closer to the average in CA I'd give it a 4*

Kxhyc0wVXLJS6qgd2kdBig.text: My wife and I loved this place when we first went years back. Food was great and came quick. But it seems each time we go the quality of the food and service declines. I get the Special Yolanda's every time. Just chicken enchiladas. At first the sauce on them was amazing. It made the dish. But each time we went the sauce was different. We went tonight and the sauce was a bland watery tomato sauce. My wife wasn't impressed with her dish either. She got the chimichangas. The cheese was watery and the refried beans looked like they had been sitting out for a while. The top of the beans was dry and cracked. The staff barely talks to you. But I think for most of them English is a second language. Still though. This place used to be pretty busy but was not even half full tonight which is a a Saturday. Plus they were slapped with numerous health code violations earlier this year. Most likely won't be back.

k1xFyJrLw4wcukaUxv7rFw.text: El Paso is our favorite Mexican  restaurant. Great food, large portions, the best chips and salsa we've ever had. Nice people and a clean place to enjoy a nice meal. The price is reasonable as well.

kCfsmcX1EEkiYWCFsqo4dA.text: Customer service was a joke. Kept the door locked during business hours and didn't have the courtesy to inform they were closed and instead chose to peek from the kitchen area. Never going back again.

-I0mEUU2MS-JRmz7ndgasA.text: A group of friends and I have been meeting here weekly for many months. The food is always good, prices are also inexpensive and the service is good.  In my opinion isn't about as perfect of a Mexican place as you can ask for. Good chips, good salsa and good food, either local sports or soccer on the TVs.   Highly recommended.

JRbnhRDbru4AqhlZysSbuA.text: I was here not too long ago and was disappointed. I am all about supporting local and family run businesses.  I wanted to give this place a second change.  I hate to say, I don't think I'll be returning.  The margaritas tasted like a watered down powdered lime drink.  The nachos came out in about two minutes and the cheese wasn't even melted.  I hope they make improvements.  They are nice people and I don't want them to go out of business.

M4PVSH45GeXo8jz8QdjMhA.text: I really enjoyed this place.   Me and a buddy went for lunch.    The service was fast, the food was hot, and the place was clean.  I liked the decor / murals.    The dish I had was called Molcajete.   The bowl is hot to touch and felt like it was eating the mexican version of the Korean dish Bi Bim Bap.  Steak, Chicken, and Shrimp cooked to perfection.    The sauce was onions, peppers, and you various spices (almost stew like).  It is offered with a plate of rice, refried beans, pico de gallo / lettuce, sour cream, and warm flour tortillas.  Awesome food.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Molcajete - this was phenomenal (the bowl is hot to touch).

FVUTFXxsWFKIrrA01ZyWBw.text: I love the fajitas at El Paso regardless of which location. So far I've only been to the Mt Lebanon and Bridgeville locations. The food is great and you always get free chips and salsa! What else can we ask for?!   The fajitas come with a sizzling plate of fajita (proteins, onions, peppers, tomatoes) with rice, beans, lettuce, guac, sour cream and flour tortillas. I love everything that comes with it. So when in doubt... order fajitas! You won't regret it! Provecho!

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Fajitas side
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Chicken and Beef fajitas

FzIXjZTSP3L4WuA4D1KVuA.text: I love this place simply because the waiters and staff are all fabulous!! Always polite and on spot. The moccahete is most delicious with tender beef, chicken, and shrimp. The chicken tacos are so juicy! Chips are always fresh and salsa is on point, just enough spice!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States

t3tsJAoblLTmqnzofTg2eg.text: We were in need of a quick lunch and decided to give El Paso a go. The decor is nice and it is easy to get into from the parking lot. The food was only so-so, however.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Taquitos.
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Three tacos a la carte.
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Frida Kahlo

dmfd9M_x-sWSxOSWeOOXXg.text: Food was awesome but the service was terrible!!  Had to ask for things 2-3 times. He never came to check on us and got our order wrong.  Will not be rushing back there!

OUQ0FR03VOwsqRm2OPfQMg.text: Great burritos for a decent price. The pork on my burrito tasted great. Perfectly seasoned. Good guac. The wait staff were great.

MMyhPoZKZfTQzdCqJFFs9g.text: Just OK overall. nothing wrong with the food, just not what I was hoping for... nothing meaningful hot ( spicy with taste) Mexican fare. Food was mild and even more of a sweet flavor rather in some of the sauces. The sausage ( chirizo) in the burrito I ordered was good,but sauces and seasoning not anything hot/spicy.  The service was good and the place seemed clean - would  have offered 3 stars except the prices, a little on the high side for what you get.

8Dif1RPNJFaZbe42hNz5Uw.text: I found this restaurant have to go in for work out at LA fitness. I'm kind of picky about Mexican restaurants if this is my new favorite in this part of town my dinner consisted of the camera nice with white sauce it was delicious. The wait staff was excellent they brought the licious chips with salsayou can spice that salsa up to your level of enjoyment. I will be coming back here again and again. The prices are reasonable. I got 12 good size shrimp with my order. I think that's more than fair. They favor the spices of Quintana Roo.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Delicious Shrimp.

OPO4ROrgb3l_iLcg-zafUQ.text: Delicious food with Great hand drawn and painted wall murals. Chips and salsa we're plentiful and portion sizes are huge!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. The sketch
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Gorgeous mural
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Chicken Burrito kids meal with fries

clRGBFqsv7DZf5IOBQ8Hfg.text: My boyfriend and I came here for lunch today. The parking wasn't bad at all. The restaurant was not crowded at all. We were seated right away.  The brought chips and salsa over right away. And the server came over once but we weren't ready to order. We finally got our orders in. I got the crab quesadilla and my boy friend had a burrito. Both dishes were very large and filled us both up. I didn't really love it because there was not much crab and you could tell it was imitation and not very good. The little crab that was in it was clumped together . My quesadilla came with rice and beans. We didn't even finish all the food. We also ordered cheese dip and we always had chips at the table.   My boyfriend is pretty regular here and he loves it. I would come again and not get the quesadilla.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Chips
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States. Crab quesadilla

yIu8GOuv22GPlA6muDrdtw.text: 5/5. I loved the food here!! It was authentic and just the right amount of spice. Our server was great -- very attentive and always checking in. I would definitely come back for their drink specials too. I loved the nice outdoor patio, and their portions were very generous.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States

KWcMIGqdpxo200o0-AIMJQ.text: Reasonably priced authentic Mexican food. Service and parking were good. Mexican music plays in the background, hand painted murals line the walls, and they have a full service bar. The waiters speak Spanish and English. There is 25 cent candy for the kids at the register. We always stop in here when we are in town. Great spot and you'll leave full every time.

photos.caption: Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States
Photo of El Paso Mexican Grill - Bridgeville, PA, United States

xFbt9u-paGbpikxr6ksCYQ.text: Absolutely horrible service. The server barely speaks and just mumbles under his breath. He is also very rude and aggressive. My mom ordered another drink bc she didn't like hers, he yelled at her saying she still had to pay (which she had planned on it, she just wanted a different drink). My mom said she knew that and she would pay and he walked away. He came back with her drink and my mom told him he was acting very rude. He didn't respond and when he came to get our bill he slammed his hand on the table so hard to grab it, didn't say a word, and walked away. He actually said 0 words to us after my mom ordered a new drink.   I've never seen someone act that way when they absolutely weren't provoked at all. It was crazy.   The food and drinks are mediocre too. What you'd expect from a dingy Mexican restaurant.

zBMGsjOJI2UiEf5N9vM0cg.text: Great service great people and great food! Our first time there and it won't be the last. My wife doesn't eat much Mexican but she really liked the food there. We will be going back a few times!

-C9CCCyQRmLB57Hrxw1p1w.text: El Paso Mexican Grill has been in Bridgeville for awhile now, and I have never visited there! My boyfriend was at Rumfish Grille for happy hour on Friday night and was planning on picking us up dinner. I knew this place was right next door so I suggested stopping there.   The menu was hard to find online (maybe a lot of people don't order take out from here?) I don't even know if I ordered from the right menu to be honest! I ended up just ordering soft tacos- they come with 3 so I got 2 chicken and 1 beef. Chris wanted the "Cielo Mar y Tierra" it was some kind of mixed skillet. I also ordered us chips and guacamole. My tacos arrived really soggy and Chris's meal wasn't even what I ordered! The guacamole also wasn't very good and didn't seem homemade- how can ya even mess up guac?!  Last, when  I called to order, all of the workers were extremely rude. I talked to about 3 different people on the phone when I called which was also kind of weird. I can think of about 15 other Mexican places I would go before coming back to El Paso.

lNKpV-5Cn9I_gedTkWyrxQ.text: Good eats at a decent price. Get the cheese dip/sauce! I always get a combo cause you cant go wrong with a little bit of everything

PEc_ME0VJOz_cIeTVXY_zQ.text: Oh how I miss home! This will be my new place to get my fix on Mexican food! I just recently started eating differently and was afraid I wasn't going to be able to enjoy foods I love, well to my surprise they have a vegetarian section on the menu!! Lots to choose from including my favorite chalupa!! You won't be disappointed!

2V_DR3TnOs4kaVMZsPkNLw.text: This is coming from someone who doesn't normally eat Mexican food. Nothing wrong with it I just don't really like spicy foods. However I have to say my experience here was an enjoyable one. The atmosphere was calm and quiet for a Friday night and the food was delicious even for me. We did get one meal come to the table wrong but mistakes happen. Definitely gonna return again soon.

7BmYFFefvC50d8X_AC8Ccw.text: El Paso used to be my favorite local Mexican place.  When they first opened, and for the few years following, the guacamole was fresh, the food was consistently good and you always knew what you were getting, and the people who worked there were attentive and nice.  I went a couple months ago and was astonished with its decline.  I decided to go the other day to give it another try, and was even more disappointed.  Everything tastes like it came out of a can.  The guacamole definitely came out of a bag, the salsa was "meh" at best, and the quesadilla was no longer spectacular.  I used to go there just to get a quesadilla, so to get what I got this time in comparison was just sad.  And to top it all off, the guy who waited on us has been there the longest of all of them, and seemed so thrilled (sarcasm font) to still be working there.  He threw our drinks on the table AS he was walking away, was mostly silent when taking our order, threw our food on the table AS he was walking away again, didn't ask how anything was, and just gave us our check.  It's sad because it used to be so good; the new murals on the walls aren't even finished, but alas, I will not be back to see the finished product.  If Taco Bell is better than you, you're doing something wrong.

nCiyqY0R48xfwoGTIklgiw.text: We are new to Bridgeville and we absolutely love this place.  Great food.  Good service.  Good prices.  Love it!
